page.title: 03Donisthorpe Colliery.
page.content: The Colliery is situated towards the Southern end of the south Derbyshire coalfield and on the edge of the village of Donisthorpe in North West Leicestershire. The present Colliery consists of three connected units:-Donisthorpe,Oak thorpe and Walton Way. Donisthorpe Colliery shaft sinking was commenced on 1st of March,1871 by Checkland and Williams. In the period 1903-1919 many changes took place e.g.new electricity generating plant on surface with electricity replacing oil and steam engines underground.As a result of improvements output almost trebled from 103,474 tons in 1903 to 300,000 tons in 1919.In 1919 about 90 horses and ponies were employed.The colliery possessed about 50 houses for the accommodation of workmen.
